awd_titl_txt: High-Power HF Magnetospheric, Ionospheric, and Atmospheric  Radar Facility
awd_abstract_narration: 9318665  Duncan  An International Radiophysics Consortium is initiating long-range  facility, making use of existing and upgraded high-power HF  transmitting and receiving systems in Russia and Ukraine.  The goal  of this multinational collaborative effort is to develop a high-  power HF backscatter radar designed for unique observations of the  near-earth magnetosphere, the mid-latitude ionosphere, and the  middle and lower atmosphere.  Preliminary design and development  work for the necessary facility modifications has been completed by  staff of the Radiophysical Research Institute (NIRFI) in Nizhny  Novgorod, Russia.  The present proposal requests support for a  Small Grant for Exploratory research (SGER) to permit the immediate  commencement of construction of the required new transmitting  antenna, to be located at the existing Sura HF facility in  Vasilsursk, Russia (56.13oN,46.10oE).  It is extremely critical that  construction of the antenna begin in Summer, 1993; otherwise, NIRFI  personnel, equipment, and government support for this effort will  be reassigned to other activities and not be available for future  application to this project.    ***
org_div_long_name: Division of Atmospheric and Geospace Sciences
